com.camerontec.util.text

Class AsciiNumberCodecUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.camerontec.util.text.AsciiNumberCodecUtil

  • public final class AsciiNumberCodecUtil
extends Object
    Utility methods to aid with encoding and decoding of ASCII numbers.

    There is some overlap between the features of this class and AsciiNumberConversionUtil in terms of functionality but not implementation. The utility methods here:

    • Encode directly to and from a Buffer which means that it is at least possible to avoid secondary byte copies from intermediate storage
    • Do not rely on internal caches of pre-fabricated conversions and so has minimal memory footprint and better performance across the entire range of numbers

      • decodeAsciiAsInt

        public static int decodeAsciiAsInt(Buffer source,
                                   int index,
                                   int length)
        Decode an ASCII encoded integer from the specified source.

        This method skips over a leading '+' and any number of leading '0' bytes.

        Parameters:
        source - The source buffer.
        index - The index at which to start decoding.
        length - The number of bytes to decode.
        Returns:
        The decoded integer.
        Throws:
        NumberFormatException - If no integer can be decoded.

      • decodeAsciiAsLong

        public static long decodeAsciiAsLong(Buffer source,
                                     int index,
                                     int length)
        Decode an ASCII encoded long from the specified source.

        This method skips over a leading '+' and any number of leading '0' bytes.

        Parameters:
        source - The source buffer.
        index - The index at which to start decoding.
        length - The number of bytes to decode.
        Returns:
        The decoded long.
        Throws:
        NumberFormatException - If no long can be decoded.
